outline:
1. to remove, draw out, draw off, take off, withdraw, equip (for war), arm for war, rescue, be rescued
    1. (Qal) equipped (participle)
    2. (Niphal)
      1. to be equipped
      2. to go equipped
      3. to be armed
    3. (Hiphil)
      1. to make strong, brace up
      2. to invigorate
    4. to draw off or out, withdraw
      1. (Qal)
        1. to draw, draw off
        2. to withdraw
      2. (Niphal)
        1. to be delivered
        2. to be saved
      3. (Piel)
        1. to pull out, tear out
        2. to rescue, deliver, set free
        3. to take away, plunder
kjv_def: arm (self), (go, ready) armed ([idiom] man, soldier), deliver, draw out, make fat, loose, (ready) prepared, put off, take away, withdraw self.
strongs_def: to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen
